summary: The Department of Homeland Security planned to spend $7 billion in fiscal year 2016 on major acquisitions—including ships, screening equipment, and surveillance technology. We reviewed 26 of DHS's major acquisition programs and found that, for the first time, they all had approved cost, schedule, and performance baselines to measure progress. DHS has taken steps to strengthen management of its major acquisitions, but some programs continued...
title: Homeland Security Acquisitions: Earlier Requirements Definition and Clear Documentation of Key Decisions Could Facilitate Ongoing Progress
